messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Presents for Kids
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 11/5/02 1:54:27 PM Central Standard Time, ... If it is an RC car, then yes, it needs the battery thing. And it is best to get two batteries
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 11/5/02 1:54:27 PM Central Standard Time,
jwoolfolk@... writes:

> Its almost that time of year again and ds really, really, really wants a Air
> Rebound R/C (its that remote contol thing with the big tire in front) but
> its $80 with the battery pack. Does anyones kids have this? Do they like
> it?
> Does it need the stupid $30 battery thing?
>
> Thanks
> Julie
>

If it is an RC car, then yes, it needs the battery thing. And it is best to
get two batteries and a charger.

~Nancy


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Presents for Kids
messages.msgSnippet: Hey all (this might be OT, but...) Its almost that time of year again and ds really, really, really wants a Air Rebound R/C (its that remote contol thing with
messages.messageBody:
Hey all (this might be OT, but...)

Its almost that time of year again and ds really, really, really wants a Air
Rebound R/C (its that remote contol thing with the big tire in front) but
its $80 with the battery pack. Does anyones kids have this? Do they like it?
Does it need the stupid $30 battery thing?

Thanks
Julie
